title: Complete or Edit Another User's Profile

activities.message: Oh, also, the impact of this is pretty severe beyond just changing a user's name since this form also allows me to change their password. If an attacker knows the victims email address, they could them login as them and own the account.

activities.message:
Hmm... 

So, trying to change my "hacked" profile back legitimately now returns a 401 not authorized with a message, invalid token. https://sandbox.veris.in/portal/user-settings/ and clicking the edit link beside administrator information. I assume it is trying to validate my user token which was previously submitted via a cookie but removed per #123748?

Beyond that, if I used my malicious account (user 2 from above) to try and change my victims account (user 1 from above), I now get a 404 when I go to /portal/complete-profile/XXXXX/ - so that looks good.

Looks like the only issue is confirming where that cookie with the user token was used, assuming that is the underlying issue for why the legitimate account profile can't be changed.

pete

activities.message:
No dice.

- First test was actually with a browser that had never been logged into veris
- tried a private browsing session - so no cookies available, still can't do it
- deleted all cookies and history from the beginning of time, still can't do it

401 unauthorized, invalid token each time.

activities.message:
Hi @veris-nayan ,
So, confirmed that:

- I can now update my profile. However, I'd note from a user experience perspective, when I updated the profile, my full name in the div class="profile-info-name" just above the administrator information box didn't change though the Full Name and profile image changed. BUT, when I reload the page, the profile image, div values referenced above and Full name revert to the previous values. When I log out and log in, I finally see all the new values reflected.

- I cannot navigate to /portal/complete-profile/XXXXX/ to edit a profile

- It doesn't seem like I can complete the profile for an existing profile by going to /portal/complete-profile/

However, I would flag - I created a new profile and tried to complete it as a malicious user before the a victim could. I used the new path with /EMAIL/TOKEN/USERID. I added 123 as the token and got a message that it was invalid when I submitted. That redirected me to a page that said my token is no longer valid and to log in to edit my profile.

I thought I would be locked out since I hadn't set a password for this new account but I went back to my email verification, tried the link and it still worked. 

Flagging because the user flow doesn't really match here - I would have expected that emailed token to have been expired given the message I received.

Other than that, looks good.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @veris-nayan ,
So, confirmed that:

  • I can now update my profile. However, I'd note from a user experience perspective, when I updated the profile, my full name in the div class="profile-info-name" just above the administrator information box didn't change though the Full Name and profile image changed. BUT, when I reload the page, the profile image, div values referenced above and Full name revert to the previous values. When I log out and log in, I finally see all the new values reflected.

  • I cannot navigate to /portal/complete-profile/XXXXX/ to edit a profile

  • It doesn't seem like I can complete the profile for an existing profile by going to /portal/complete-profile/

However, I would flag - I created a new profile and tried to complete it as a malicious user before the a victim could. I used the new path with /EMAIL/TOKEN/USERID. I added 123 as the token and got a message that it was invalid when I submitted. That redirected me to a page that said my token is no longer valid and to log in to edit my profile.

I thought I would be locked out since I hadn't set a password for this new account but I went back to my email verification, tried the link and it still worked.

Flagging because the user flow doesn't really match here - I would have expected that emailed token to have been expired given the message I received.

Other than that, looks good.

activities.message:
Following the issue faced by you and a lot of other researchers, we completely revamped the way onboarding used to work. So that's why your old links won't be working. And you are right, the other email is locked out. 

All in all, the main goal is satisfied I guess, which is securing the process of onboarding. Do let me know via another report if we still have other vulnerabilities.
activities.markdown_message:
Following the issue faced by you and a lot of other researchers, we completely revamped the way onboarding used to work. So that's why your old links won't be working. And you are right, the other email is locked out.

All in all, the main goal is satisfied I guess, which is securing the process of onboarding. Do let me know via another report if we still have other vulnerabilities.

activities.message: Thanks for your help. Veris feels more secured now.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for your help. Veris feels more secured now.

vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,
I've found an issue where verified users can complete and submit a profile on behalf of another user. I've attached two video POCs (unlisted on YouTube).

Completion - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=erH7ShUpqso
Editing - https://youtu.be/IQboAIHNpq4

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Register a new user account
  2. Verify the account via the email from Veris
  3. Do not complete the profile but note the url. Create a new account.
  4. Complete the account creation for the second user.
  5. Logged in as the second user, navigate to the profile creation url from the first user.
  6. Submit the values.
  7. User 1 receives an email that their profile has been created.

Additionally, even after a profile has been set up, you can still edit it as a second user, at least if the steps above are followed. Assuming you did the steps above:

  1. Navigate back to the /portal/complete-profile/XXXXX/
  2. Change the values and resubmit the form
  3. User 1 receives an email that their profile has been updated

Please let me know if you need any additional information.
vulnerability_information:
Hi,
I've found an issue where verified users can complete and submit a profile on behalf of another user. I've attached two video POCs (unlisted on YouTube).

Completion - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=erH7ShUpqso
Editing - https://youtu.be/IQboAIHNpq4

Steps to reproduce:
1. Register a new user account
2. Verify the account via the email from Veris
3. Do not complete the profile but note the url. Create a new account.
4. Complete the account creation for the second user.
5. Logged in as the second user, navigate to the profile creation url from the first user.
6. Submit the values.
7. User 1 receives an email that their profile has been created.

Additionally, even after a profile has been set up, you can still edit it as a second user, at least if the steps above are followed. Assuming you did the steps above:

8. Navigate back to the /portal/complete-profile/XXXXX/
9. Change the values and resubmit the form
10. User 1 receives an email that their profile has been updated

Please let me know if you need any additional information.
